titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stanford University Stereograph Collection PC0114
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig & Jenny Johnson

origination.label: creator

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Stanford subjects, circa 1900-1905, include athletics, the stadium, Quad views, two groups of male students, and earthquake damage (1905) to the gymnasium, church, and library. There is a series of Lawrence & Houseworth stereographs of hydraulic mining in California, ca. 1865, with two scenic views of California. There is a series of San Diego views by Keystone View Company, including several of submarines in the Bay, ca. 1920. Miscellaneous views include snow in Sacramento 1873 and one view labeled New York City but possibly of San Francisco.

accessrestrict.head: Access to Collection
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research use.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94305-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/spc/using-collections/permission-publish.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Stanford University Stereograph Collection (PC0114). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.
